comments.body: Hmm.. Should we be checking for the default timestamp here? I had expected that we would use `None` if the default is used.
Wouldn't the default be when the `expireTimestamp` argument is not provided? which will be taken care of by the following methods?
I had assumed so initially, but then I saw the `contains(DEFAULT_TIMESTAMP)` check below.
We should update the `toString` below to use string interpolation. Currently it is using `%d` incorrectly.
Thanks for catching this, updated in the new commit.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +35,39 @@case class OffsetAndMetadata(offsetMetadata: OffsetMetadata,
                             commitTimestamp: Long = org.apache.kafka.common.requests.OffsetCommitRequest.DEFAULT_TIMESTAMP,
                             expireTimestamp: Option[Long] = None) {

  def offset = offsetMetadata.offset
